programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: An insight into a team of engineers in Perth's attempts to not only break the 763mph land speed record set back in 1997, but also go past the 1,000mph barrier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look onboard the $200million Black Pearl, which is the largest sailing yacht in the world and has been built to sail faster than any ship of its size.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave heads to West Yorkshire to collect a rare 1926 Dodge bus. Derek gets his hands on a rare Vauxhall Victor VX 90 police car that is expected to sell for more than a few coppers.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave heads to Bolton to pick up a classic Italian sports car - a Lancia Fulvia 1.3 Sport styled by Milan coachbuilder Zagato.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The Scalextric team attempt to tap into the brand's glory years, the 1980s, and devise a plan to create a model of a classic supercar, the Lamborghini Countach.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. On the first leg, he helps feed the crew of Britain's newest battleship, discovers how the Victorians planned to repel a possible French invasion and learns there is a well-established industry in an unlikely location.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An impressive compound commandeered and repurposed by a brutal regime and an eerie complex off the coast of Ireland that became the biggest of its kind.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Victoria station to Abbey Wood in south-east London. Along the way he learns how volunteer Victorian firefighters liked a tipple, discovers that 19th-century sewage pumps were a marvel of design and puts in a shift at the oldest fish market in Britain.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on train journeys through Edwardian Britain, exploring the grand estates of Norfolk and a bivouac on Brownsea Island on the way. He also learns the ropes aboard an Edwardian wherry on the Norfolk Broads.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores an Edwardian utopia in Letchworth, where he meets a fourth generation citizen who introduces him to the town's community spirit. programme.desc: Daly and Rawton find themselves pulling pints as part of an investigation into a protection racket targeting pubs, giving a whole new meaning to the phrase 'behind bars'. Ray Ashcroft and Libby Davison star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank gives Peggy a honeymoon cruise for her birthday. Tony and Luca fight over Sarah. Tony gets arrested. Barry and Natalie set up a dating agency. Melanie moves in with Ian.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sarah and Tony make up after the incident with Luca. Peggy comes out of hospital. Roy talks to Dr Fonseca about Viagra and Martin burgles Matthew's house.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam receives a surprise visit from an old friend who seems to have gone up in the world since their schooldays together, but the reunion has a tragic outcome, making him question his skills as a doctor. Meanwhile, Andrew and Dawn return from their trip to the States. Medical drama, starring Joseph Millson and Gary Mavers.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.sub-title: The Lord God Made Them All
programme.desc: A 1983 Christmas edition. James returns to Darrowby after being demobbed from the army. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Victoria Wood's Midlife Christmas
programme.desc: A festive special from 2009 that attempts to cram an entire night's Christmas viewing into 60 minutes. Highlights include the Midlife Olympics 2009, popular costume drama Lark Pies to Cranchesterford and the adventures of soap star Bo Beaumont, played by Victoria's long-time collaborator Julie Walters. Others joining in the fun are Delia Smith, Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Reece Shearsmith and Anton Du Beke.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: At an ancient stone circle, Foggy, Norman and Compo meet a man waiting for visitors from outer space. Later, after sunset, Howard and Marina try meeting at the same spot. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, starring. Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: An eminent scientist on the brink of a major breakthrough in cancer research is found impaled on a razor-sharp samurai sword in his locked study. Jonathan and Maddie are called in to find out if this is a case of murder or an extremely elaborate suicide. Guest starring Annette Crosbie, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the murder of a man found in an alleyway seven years previously when he is identified on a website covering unexplained disappearances. The victim is named by a woman whose husband hired him six months before his death, but neither of them had thought anything of it when their employee went missing - and seem to know little about him. Meanwhile, Brian and Gerry are distracted by looming job cuts and fear that Ucos could be downsized. With Robert Daws and Claudie Blakley.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Rowan proposes to Lou, and, while Vicky can see right through his devious plot she is so pleased to have a supply of drugs in the family that she agrees to be her sister's bridesmaid. Janine gets permission to visit her mother's grave and has a wonderful away day with Donny, which tempts them both to do a runner. A photograph of her granddaughter inspires Julie S to battle against her cancer, and Sylvia gets an unexpected career boost.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Convinced that an Arab sheikh's driver is covering for his boss over the murder of a prostitute, he is forced to decide whether to see justice done or yield to the temptation of the bribe and back off in the 'national interest'. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A look into lingering rumors that advanced military aircraft, such as the SR-71 Blackbird and B-2 Spirit Bomber, were designed from reverse engineered alien technology.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi goes to the auction alone, while Darrell buys some vintage bottles.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod prepare to reopen the store as the buyers head for a round of auctions in Hollywood.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Don't Bid So Close to Me
programme.desc: Barry finds an item with a connection to a rock legend at an auction in Rancho Cucamonga, while Brandi and Jarrod examine a vintage mask.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers take a long journey into the desert of Lancaster, California, and Nabila Haniss is richly rewarded for making the trek.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: Nick Gowitzka's commitment to the bluefin season is tested when a family emergency occurs back on land.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: A sweet opportunity pushes Justin to re-evaluate his place on the salvage team. At a century-old theatre that has been empty for over a decade, Ted uncovers a treasure trove of First World War artifacts, including a vintage compass and bayonet.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker yearns after a client's 1955 Chevy Nomad, while the owner just wants a simple paint job.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Series following Danny Koker and his team of car experts as they remodel unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Series following Danny Koker and his team of car experts as they remodel unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is challenged to convert a 1960s Volkswagen Beetle into a child's bed.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia spans over six million square miles of some of the most rugged terrain on Earth, much of which is uninhabited and largely unexplored. It is also the home of cosmism - a belief that human civilization originated in the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The US military has denied that the infamous 1947 Roswell crash was anything other than a weather balloon, but FBI files include a memo to J Edgar Hoover.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry makes a surprising bid for a locker containing an old mattress, believing its appearance belies its true value.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell bets everything on the unknown contents of a locker in Harbor City.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover a secret in San Francisco, while Darrell takes a gamble that could cost him everything.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys interview applicants for the night shift position and examine a valuable first edition of David Thoreau's classic book Walden.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a 1920s doll of aviator Charles Lindbergh and a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to make a deal on a guitar signed by Crosby, Stills & Nash, and also examines a pair of bomb fins from the Second World War.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The cases of people who have reported being abducted by aliens. They even include one-time Republic of Kalmykia president Kirsan Ilyumzhinov, who claims that in September 1997 he was taken by aliens and travelled in their spaceship, visiting another planet.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Of all the Hindu gods, none is more important than Shiva, the great destroyer. This programme contemplates whether the deity could have been the leader of an extraterrestrial race.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck as some of Priestly's top buyers arrive at the yard. Ted closes one of his biggest sales of the year when he finally locks down a buyer for the plane fuselage and a practical joke is plotted at Ted's expense.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Tatton Park, Cheshire, sort the treasures from their trash. Items include a collection of crockery, jewellery and ornaments, which ensure the dealers get their cash out to tempt the sellers. Plus, a selection of Coronation Street autographs shows up on James Layte's table.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by antiques dealers Ian Towning and David Ford in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. The highlight of the day is a large collection of Spode ceramic pieces.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Experts investigate the life and death of a medieval woman when her skeleton is found at Tadcaster Castle, North Yorkshire.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Documentary, made in conjunctions with staff at the University of York, shedding light on the illnesses and diseases that blighted medieval life.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Great mysteries that have been frozen in time, from the mummified remains of three Inca children in the Andes to members of the ancient Yupik people in Alaska.

programme.title: Ken And Barbie Killers: The Lost Murder
programme.desc: The murders of three schoolgirls in the early 1990s shocked Canada. Now, six boxes of unseen evidence shed light on a notorious murder trial..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How crime writers research their material, combining the perspectives of police, criminals and journalists to provide detailed accounts of illegal activity.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The death of a young mother in a traffic accident on the Interstate near Des Moines, Iowa. Police used construction work cameras to piece together her final moments.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A cold case from 1957, in which a man committed several crimes in one night - including murder. California police followed numerous leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators made a breakthrough.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a determined FBI agent brought about the conviction of John Gotti, the homicidal head of the Gambino crime family in New York.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team pulls out all the stops to save a newborn foal when it is found with its abandoned mother.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert helps out with a health check for the zoo's unusual-looking alligator snapping turtles. Terri and Bindi welcome seven new lemurs from the US.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride's mother wants her daughter to wear her wedding dress, but it does not fit. However, Jo and Al come up with a plan to solve the problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Tensions run high between a bride and her demanding wedding planner, and the youngest sibling of a large family fights for her right to be heard and stands up to her sisters.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two women compete to be named maid of honour, and a bride struggles to wrestle control of her big day from a groomsmaid intent on stealing the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Canada
programme.desc: A cake designer wants an elegant lace dress for her Victorian-themed wedding, while another bride wants a 1920s look for a big day inspired by The Great Gatsby.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Canada
programme.desc: Two customers come to the shop seeking a dress that a dead parent would have loved to see them wear for their wedding.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps Tara, whose cat will not tolerate strangers, and Kurt, whose feline companion destroys or eats everything in sight.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Field operations manager Stacie DaBolt investigates when a dog with extremely matted fur and a harness embedded in its skin is brought to the shelter.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Beverly's clutter has filled every inch of her home, and her dogs have made part of the house uninhabitable. Now she faces clearing her hoard or losing it all.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Exploring the mind of an obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the often confused workings of the criminal psyche.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers try to mislead detectives by making a murder look like suicide, and the role of forensics in establishing the truth.

programme.title: The Fog of Murder
programme.desc: An earthshattering rifle shot stuns a neighbourhood, but strangely, not the dogs near the scene..

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Illinois high school student Lee Cutler, who went missing in October 2007 after failing to turn up at his part-time job at a music shop. His locked car was found almost 200 miles away containing clothes, a backpack, and blankets.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Safe Streets Task Force monitor the violent acts of a notorious gang of hoodlums who have acquired a reputation for antisocial behaviour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Between a Sham-Rock and a Hard Place
programme.desc: A bride's mum and mother-in-law have conflicting opinions over her shoulder tattoo, but hopefully the family will find it easier to agree on the wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Jessica could end up leaving empty-handed when her demands have the staff running in circles, while Monique breaks shop rules by asking her fiance to make the final decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Samantha has visited 100 different bridal stores: will Kleinfeld’s have her dream dress? And, Lia has never tried on a wedding gown and is running out of time!.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing her dress in the California wildfires, Eryka looks for a new dress. Meanwhile, bride Ashley searches for a dress to make her feel her best after losing weight.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell come to the aid of Christine Gillard, who as a teenager parted ways with her two-year-old daughter Marguerite, and has lived with the pain of their separation for nearly 50 years. The youngster was placed with a long-term foster family while her mother struggled to make ends meet, and four years later, Christine's circumstances meant she felt she had to turn down a chance for a reunion. The pair also try to help 41-year-old father-of-three Robert Lindsay, who was raised by his mother and grandparents in Kilmarnock, and now hopes to reconnect with his estranged Croatian dad.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Chay struggles with her loneliness and hits a setback in her exercise regime, and a tooth infection delays Laura's skin removal surgery.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: In October 1989 nine-year-old Jessi Toronjo went to a sleepover in 1989 thinking that her stepbrother, Jeffrey Pelley, was on his way to his senior prom. She would spend the next decade believing someone else committed an unspeakable crime which saw four members of her family killed. Years later, police reappeared, to advise they had confirmed the killer - and Jessi realised with horror that not only she had known him all along, but that her sleepover was the only reason she was still alive.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a mother-of-two and army wife found dead in her bedroom. There were messages left near her body, and a gun in her hand. Her death was initially ruled a suicide, until investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier and decided to take another look at the evidence to deduce whether murder was a possibility.

programme.title: Ken And Barbie Killers: The Lost Murder

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a woman dies, it initially appears as though she suffered an accidental fall. Through the persistence of family and friends, law enforcement discover a different story.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A street preacher and his teenage protege run an Internet scam to rob unsuspecting men, steal their identities, then dump their dead bodies in the woods.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Reconstruction of the marriage between a wife and her hot-headed husband which, when it turned sour, provided the catalyst for a bloody confrontation.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. Police found his residence undisturbed with no evidence of foul play, but his allies refused to give up their search, forcing authorities to consider such theories as murder, a government conspiracy or even alien abduction.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The manhunt for a suspected serial killer in Alaska, who left a driver paralysed in a bid to stop his victim from fleeing. Investigators hoped the snow would offer up clues - but found find themselves in a race to act before it melted.

programme.title: The Real Prime Suspect
programme.sub-title: The Kidnap and Murder of an Heiress
programme.desc: Jackie Malton re-examines the first 'Kidnap and Murder' case in British Criminal History, with detectives revealing a case of mistaken identity and torn family loyalties..

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A self-taught serial killer crisscrosses the country at random, targeting victims of opportunity and murdering them with pre-stashed weapons and tools he calls 'kill kits'.

programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance and presumed death of a surgeon's wife sparks a feverish homicide investigation.
